PHYS 225 Labs Compiled by Shovit Bhari 2020-08-11 Chapter 1 Introduction This is collection of data tables and figures for all the 225L conducted over Summer 2020 in Pivot Interactives. Physics Labs. 1.1 Error Analysis lab file Error Analysis
Chapter 2 Lab2: Position, Velocity, and Acceleration 2.1 Part1: Motion of the glider 2.2 Plots using ggplot 2.3 Part2: Acceleration of a Turbine-Powered Glider 2.4 Plots using ggplot

Chapter 2 Lab2: Position, Velocity, and Acceleration 2.1 Part1: Motion of the glider Mass of the glider, m= 0.80 kg and the strenth of fan force was selected to level 3. 2.1.1 Data time <- seq(0,0.9, by=0.1) Position<- c(0,0.02,0.06, 0.115, 0.19, 0.29, 0.4, 0.53, 0.68, 0.84) Velocity <- c(0,0.3,0.475, 0.65, 0.875, 1.05, 1.2, 1.4, 1.55,NA) 2.1.2 Creating a data table data <- data.frame(time, Position, Velocity) data ## time Position Velocity ## 1 0.0 0.000 0.000 ## 2 0.1 0.020 0.300 ## 3 0.2 0.060 0.475 ## 4 0.3 0.115 0.650 ## 5 0.4 0.190 0.875 ## 6 0.5 0.290 1.050 ## 7 0.6 0.400 1.200 ## 8 0.7 0.530 1.400 ## 9 0.8 0.680 1.550 ## 10 0.9 0.840 NA 2.1.3 Plotting Position vs. Time plot(data$time, data$Position,main="Position vs. Time", xlab="Time", ylab="Position" ) 2.1.4 Plotting Velocity vs. Time fit2<- lm(Velocity~time, data) plot(data$time, data$Velocity, main="Velocity vs. Time", xlab="Time", ylab="Velocity") abline(fit2) 2.1.5 Fitting the linear regression model and extracting the coefficients summary(fit2) ## ## Call: ## lm(formula = Velocity ~ time, data = data) ## ## Residuals: ## Min 1Q Median 3Q Max ## -0.076667 -0.011667 0.005833 0.027500 0.041667 ## ## Coefficients: ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 0.07667 0.02514 3.05 0.0186 * ## time 1.89167 0.05280 35.83 3.43e-09 *** ## --- ## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ## ## Residual standard error: 0.0409 on 7 degrees of freedom ## (1 observation deleted due to missingness) ## Multiple R-squared: 0.9946, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9938 ## F-statistic: 1284 on 1 and 7 DF, p-value: 3.427e-09 summary(fit2)$coef ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 0.07666667 0.02513719 3.04993 1.858505e-02 ## time 1.89166667 0.05279866 35.82793 3.426689e-09 slope <- round(summary(fit2)$coef[2,1],3) intercept<- round(summary(fit2)$coef[1,1],3) errorintercept <- round(summary(fit2)$coef[1,2],3) errorslope <- round(summary(fit2)$coef[2,2],3) 2.2 Plots using ggplot 2.2.1 Position vs. Time g1<- ggplot(data, aes(x=time, y=Position))+ geom_point(size = 2, colour = "red", alpha=0.5)+ xlab("Time")+ ylab("Position") + ggtitle("Position vs. time") g1 ###Velocity vs. Time g2 <- ggplot(data, aes(x=time, y=Velocity))+ geom_smooth(method = "lm", colour = "black") + xlab("Time")+ ylab("Velocity") + ggtitle("Velocity vs. time") + geom_point(size = 2, colour = "blue", alpha=0.5) g2 \[ v_o= 0.077 \pm 0.025 \frac{m}{s} \] \[ a= 1.892 \pm 0.053 \frac{m}{s^2} \] 2.2.2 Exporting data as csv file. write.table(data, "./ErrorAnalysis.csv") 2.3 Part2: Acceleration of a Turbine-Powered Glider Here’s the collected data time <- seq(0,1.4, by=0.1) Position<- c(0,0.23,0.428, 0.59, 0.72, 0.815, 0.88, 0.91, 0.905, 0.87,0.8, 0.695,0.56,0.385, 0.18) Velocity <- c(NA,2.14,1.8,1.46,1.12, 0.8, 0.475, 0.125, -0.2, -0.525, -0.875,-1.2,-1.55,-1.72,NA) 2.3.1 Creating a data table data1 <- data.frame(time, Position, Velocity) data1 ## time Position Velocity ## 1 0.0 0.000 NA ## 2 0.1 0.230 2.140 ## 3 0.2 0.428 1.800 ## 4 0.3 0.590 1.460 ## 5 0.4 0.720 1.120 ## 6 0.5 0.815 0.800 ## 7 0.6 0.880 0.475 ## 8 0.7 0.910 0.125 ## 9 0.8 0.905 -0.200 ## 10 0.9 0.870 -0.525 ## 11 1.0 0.800 -0.875 ## 12 1.1 0.695 -1.200 ## 13 1.2 0.560 -1.550 ## 14 1.3 0.385 -1.720 ## 15 1.4 0.180 NA 2.3.2 Plotting Position vs. Time plot(data1$time, data1$Position,main="Position vs. Time", xlab="Time", ylab="Position" ) 2.3.3 Plotting Velocity vs. Time fit3<- lm(Velocity~time, data1) plot(data1$time, data1$Velocity, main="Velocity vs. Time", xlab="Time", ylab="Velocity") abline(fit3) 2.3.4 Fitting the linear regression model and extracting the coefficients summary(fit3) ## ## Call: ## lm(formula = Velocity ~ time, data = data1) ## ## Residuals: ## Min 1Q Median 3Q Max ## -0.047802 -0.017308 -0.009011 0.003791 0.111099 ## ## Coefficients: ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 2.44462 0.02361 103.5 <2e-16 *** ## time -3.28901 0.02974 -110.6 <2e-16 *** ## --- ## Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 ## ## Residual standard error: 0.04013 on 11 degrees of freedom ## (2 observations deleted due to missingness) ## Multiple R-squared: 0.9991, Adjusted R-squared: 0.999 ## F-statistic: 1.223e+04 on 1 and 11 DF, p-value: < 2.2e-16 summary(fit3)$coef ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 2.444615 0.02360802 103.5502 8.513850e-18 ## time -3.289011 0.02974331 -110.5798 4.136457e-18 slope1 <- round(summary(fit3)$coef[2,1],3) intercept1<- round(summary(fit3)$coef[1,1],3) errorintercept1 <- round(summary(fit3)$coef[1,2],3) errorslope1 <- round(summary(fit3)$coef[2,2],3) 2.4 Plots using ggplot 2.4.1 Position vs. Time g3<- ggplot(data1, aes(x=time, y=Position))+ geom_point(size = 2, colour = "red", alpha=0.5)+ xlab("Time")+ ylab("Position") + ggtitle("Position vs. time") g3 ###Velocity vs. Time g4 <- ggplot(data1, aes(x=time, y=Velocity))+ geom_smooth(method = "lm", colour = "black") + xlab("Time")+ ylab("Velocity") + ggtitle("Velocity vs. time") + geom_point(size = 2, colour = "blue", alpha=0.5) g4 \[ v_o= 2.445 \pm 0.024 \frac{m}{s} \] \[ a= -3.289 \pm 0.03 \frac{m}{s^2} \]

Chapter 4 Lab 4: Three Views of Projectile Ball 4.1 Data ## t x vx y vy ## 1 0.0 0.00 NA 1.00 NA ## 2 0.1 0.70 6.75 1.50 4.50 ## 3 0.2 1.35 6.50 1.90 3.25 ## 4 0.3 2.00 6.50 2.15 2.00 ## 5 0.4 2.65 6.50 2.30 1.25 ## 6 0.5 3.30 1.00 2.40 0.00 ## 7 0.6 4.00 6.75 2.30 -1.25 ## 8 0.7 4.65 6.75 2.15 -2.00 ## 9 0.8 5.30 6.50 1.90 -2.75 ## 10 0.9 5.95 6.50 1.60 -3.50 ## 11 1.0 6.50 6.00 1.20 -4.50 ## 12 1.1 NA NA 0.70 NA xt <- lm(x~t, data) plot(t,x, xlab="Time", ylab="Horizontal Position", main = "Horizontal Displacement") abline(xt) summary(xt)$coef ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 0.03636364 0.02044051 1.778998 1.089484e-01 ## t 6.54545455 0.03455077 189.444532 1.618403e-17 \[ v_x = 6.545 \pm 0.035 \frac{m}{s} \] vt <- lm(vx~t, data) plot(t,vx, xlab="Time", ylab="Horizontal Velocity", main = "Horizontal Velocity") abline(vt) summary(vt)$coef ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 5.98333333 1.276445 4.687497916 0.001566592 ## t -0.01515152 2.057177 -0.007365196 0.994303830 \[ a = -0.015 \pm 2.057 \frac{m}{s^2} \] plot(t,y, xlab="Time", ylab="Vertical Position", main = "Vertical Displacement") vyt <- lm(vy~t, data) plot(t,vy, xlab="Time", ylab="Vertical Velocity", main = "Vertical Velocity") abline(vyt) summary(vyt)$coef ## Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) ## (Intercept) 5.133333 0.1851835 27.72025 3.094896e-09 ## t -9.878788 0.2984502 -33.10028 7.571623e-10 \[ v_o = 5.133 \pm 0.185 \frac{m}{s} \] \[ g = -9.879 \pm 0.298 \frac{m}{s^2} \]

Chapter 5 Lab 5:Modified Atwood’s Machine and Newton’s 2nd Law t x y vx vy 1 0.00 0.000 0.425 NA NA 2 0.05 0.010 0.420 0.25 -0.15 3 0.10 0.025 0.410 0.35 -0.30 4 0.15 0.045 0.390 0.45 -0.45 5 0.20 0.070 0.365 0.60 -0.50 6 0.25 0.105 0.340 0.75 -0.65 7 0.30 0.145 0.300 0.85 -0.75 8 0.35 0.190 0.265 0.95 -0.85 9 0.40 0.240 0.215 1.10 -1.05 10 0.45 0.300 0.160 1.20 -1.15 11 0.50 0.360 0.100 1.30 -1.20 12 0.55 0.430 0.040 NA NA 5.0.1 Horizontal Mass x1 <- ggplot(lab5, aes(t, x)) + geom_point(col="red") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Displacement of the horizontal mass", x="Time", y = "Position")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) x1 Coefficients of the horizontal mass xt <- lm(vx~t, lab5) summary(xt)$coef Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) 0.12 0.01322876 9.071147 1.748825e-05 t 2.40 0.04264014 56.284989 1.101879e-11 slope1 <- round(summary(xt)$coef[2,1],3) intercept1<- round(summary(xt)$coef[1,1],3) ei1 <- round(summary(xt)$coef[1,2],3) es1 <- round(summary(xt)$coef[2,2],3) v1<- ggplot(lab5, aes(t, vx)) + geom_smooth(method='lm', formula=y~x, se=FALSE)+ geom_point(col="red") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Velocity of horizontal mass", x="Time", y = "Velocity")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) v1 Initial velocity of the horizontal mass \[ v_x = 0.12 \pm 0.013 \frac{m}{s} \] Acceleration of the horizontal mass \[ a_x = 2.4 \pm 0.043 \frac{m}{s^2} \] 5.0.2 Hanging Mass y1 <- ggplot(lab5, aes(t, y)) + geom_point(col="green") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Displacement of the hanging mass", x="Time", y = "Position")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) y1 Coefficients of the vertical mass yt <- lm(vy~t, lab5) summary(yt)$coef Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) (Intercept) -0.05333333 0.02298990 -2.31986 4.893015e-02 t -2.36969697 0.07410315 -31.97836 9.958283e-10 slope2 <- round(summary(yt)$coef[2,1],3) intercept2<- round(summary(yt)$coef[1,1],3) ei2 <- round(summary(yt)$coef[1,2],3) es2 <- round(summary(yt)$coef[2,2],3) v2<- ggplot(lab5, aes(t, vy)) + geom_smooth(method='lm', formula=y~x, se=FALSE)+ geom_point(col="green") + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Velocity of the hanging mass", x="Time", y = "Velocity")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) v2 Initial velocity of the vertical mass \[ v_y = -0.053 \pm 0.023 \frac{m}{s} \] Acceleration of the vertical mass \[ a_y = -2.37 \pm 0.074 \frac{m}{s^2} \]

Chapter 8 Lab 8: Conservation of Energy data <- data.frame(tA,xA, tC, xC, tH, xH, tI, xI, tK, xK) height velocity velocitysq 1 0.030 0.474 0.224676 2 0.085 1.000 1.000000 3 0.205 1.902 3.617604 4 0.235 2.027 4.108729 5 0.290 2.309 5.331481 g <- ggplot(data=datav, aes(x=height, y=velocitysq)) + geom_point(col="red") + geom_smooth(method='lm', se=TRUE) + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Velocity Squared vs Height", x="Height", y = "Velocity Squared")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) p <- ggplotly(g) ## `geom_smooth()` using formula 'y ~ x' p \[g = 9.9775 \pm 0.3335\]

Chapter 11 Lab 11: Ballistic Pendulum 11.0.1 Data data <- data.frame(time, position) data time position 1 0.00000 0.00 2 0.00125 0.10 3 0.00250 0.19 4 0.00375 0.31 5 0.00500 0.41 6 0.00625 0.51 fit<- lm(position~time, data) slope <- round(summary(fit)$coef[2,1],3) intercept<- round(summary(fit)$coef[1,1],3) ei <- round(summary(fit)$coef[1,2],3) es <- round(summary(fit)$coef[2,2],3) g <- ggplot(data=data, aes(x=time, y=position)) + geom_point(col="red") + geom_smooth(method='lm', se=TRUE) + theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5)) + labs(title = "Position vs Time", x="Time", y = "Position")+ theme(plot.title = element_text(color="blue", size=14, face="bold")) p <- ggplotly(g) p \[ v_o = 82.286 \pm 1.32 \frac{m}{s} \]
